We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Storekeeper
Job Location: Wuse Zone 7, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dependable and detail-oriented Storekeeper to manage the inventory of food items, ingredients, packaging materials, and restaurant supplies.
	The Storekeeper will be responsible for receiving, storing, issuing, and maintaining accurate stock records to ensure a smooth flow of operations across the restaurant outlets.


Responsibilities


	Receive, inspect, and verify incoming supplies and materials.
	Ensure proper storage and labelling of all items according to safety and hygiene standards.
	Issue materials and ingredients to kitchen and restaurant staff based on requisitions.
	Maintain accurate inventory records using manual logs or inventory management software.
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile with physical inventory.
	Monitor stock levels and notify the Procurement Manager of low or critical items.
	Ensure storage areas are clean, organised, and compliant with health and safety regulations.
	Prevent spoilage, wastage, and theft by implementing effective stock control measures.
	Assist in the preparation of inventory reports and audits.
	Ensure First-In, First-Out (FIFO) stock rotation method is followed at all times.
	Collaborate with the Procurement and Kitchen teams to ensure supply chain efficiency.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND; additional training in storekeeping, inventory control, or logistics is an advantage.
	1-5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in the food service or hospitality industry.
	Knowledge of food safety and storage guidelines.
	Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy.

title: Job Vacancies at Fine Brothers Limited
content:
Fine Brothers Limited is the consumers’ first choice source for Mobile Phones, Tablet PCs, Laptops, Quality Electronics and Inverter /Solar Power Systems and accessories. Fine Brothers Limited takes the lead in customer service innovations. All sales are supported with after-sales support; Warranty, Repairs and Services. We provide quality products and services throughout our outlets across Nigeria. We have gone beyond the shores of Enugu with Sales outlets across Nigeria. The company have displayed a long track of integrity, customer satisfaction and Professionalism. We offer an exciting and challenging work environment for individuals to reach their career goals.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

            
    



1.) Retail Sales Representative

Job Location: Abakaliki, Ebonyi
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs
	Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships
	Reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction
	Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
	Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments
	Analyze the territory/market’s potential, track sales and status reports
	Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.
	Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends
	Continuously improve through feedback.


Requirements


	NCE, OND, HND / Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	1 - 7 years of proven work experience as a Sales Representative
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office
	Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
	Excellent selling, negotiation and communication skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.


Application Closing Date: 18th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: ngozichukwua@finebrothers.com.ng using the Job Position and Locationas the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Retail Sales Representative

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT), Awka - Anambra, Enugu and Owerri - Imo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs
	Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships
	Reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction
	Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
	Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments
	Analyze the territory/market’s potential, track sales and status reports
	Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.
	Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends
	Continuously improve through feedback.


Requirements


	NCE, OND, HND / Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	1 - 7 years of proven work experience as a Sales Representative
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office
	Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
	Excellent selling, negotiation and communication skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.


Application Closing Date: 24th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: ngozichukwua@finebrothers.com.ng using the Job Position and locationas the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Retail Sales Representative

Job Locations: Awka - Anambra & Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs
	Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships
	Reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction
	Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
	Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments
	Analyze the territory/market’s potential, track sales and status reports
	Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.
	Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends
	Continuously improve through feedback.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	1 - 7 years of proven work experience as a Sales Representative
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office
	Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
	Excellent selling, negotiation and communication skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: ngozichukwua@finebrothers.com.ng using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location: Okpara Avenue, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Supervise daily warehouse operations (receiving, storage, picking, packing, dispatch);receiving and storing shipments from suppliers.
	Managing inventory accuracy rate.
	Picking and packing orders for branches or walk-in customers.
	Maintaining a clean and organized warehouse, compliance with safety standards.
	Conducting regular inventory counts and reporting discrepancies.
	Assisting with order fulfillment and shipping processes (order fulfillment speed and accuracy).
	Reduction in stock discrepancies/damages by maintaining accurate inventory records and conduct audits.
	Implementing safety protocols, such as proper storage and handling procedures.
	Adhering to regulations and standards for device storage and distribution, etc.
	Ensure timely distribution of devices and accessories to nationwide branches.
	Train, mentor, and supervise warehouse staff.
	In conclusion, he or she would be Overseeing and managing the day-to-day operations of the warehouse, including receiving, storing, and disbursing products or materials, while ensuring efficient coordination amongst the staff.
	Monitoring and enforcing compliance with company policies and safety regulations to ensure the safety of all warehouse employees and goods.
	Their work ensures that goods are properly stored, handled, and delivered to branches/customers in a timely and safe manner.


Requirements


	Should possess B.Sc or HND in Supply Chain, Logistics, Business Administration or any other related discipline.
	Should have at least 2 years of experience in warehouse/logistics supervisory role.
	Must have completed NYSC.
	Possess expert knowledge of Microsoft office packages, ERP or FOCUS software.
	Must be punctual and detailed.
	Candidates should not be aabove 35 years of age.


Application Closing Date: 17th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: hr@finebrothers.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, call 08118902773.
